meanings.sent1: Without food, the plants will perish.
meanings.sent2: If you don't wear a seatbelt, you could perish in a car accident.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream will perish if left out in the sun too long.
meanings.sent4: The old traditions slowly perish in the face of modernity.
meanings.sent5: The fragile butterfly will perish if handled roughly.

meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization perished due to a great flood.
meanings.sent2: Without shelter, the homeless may perish in the harsh winter.
meanings.sent3: Leaving the cake out too long caused it to perish before the party.
meanings.sent4: The hopes of the villagers perished when the crops failed.
meanings.sent5: The pirate's ship began to perish in the stormy seas.

meanings.definition: To come to an end or disappear
meanings.sent1: If you don't water the flowers, they will perish quickly.
meanings.sent2: The memories of that day will never perish in my mind.
meanings.sent3: The chances of winning the lottery seem to perish with each ticket bought.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the light begins to perish from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The magic in the world seemed to perish as people grew older.
